result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven P Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reporter: Ann Albert
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Diane H
  - Defendant shall not be at the 5800 block of Balsam Road in Madison WI
  - Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $2,000.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring. Cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $4,000.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
  Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
